answers.answer: OMGoodness, that is just awful. I will keep your whole family in my prayers.
I'll be praying for your sister and the baby. Let us know what happens.
She is 26 weeks today and so far knock on wood, so good

question: My sister is 24 1/2 weeks pregnant and in the hopsital with preeclampsia and high blood pressure and high uric acid and proteins in the urine to the point where she may have to deliver any day if her kidneys go to renal failure. She is 42 and all medicated and we are very concerned for her health and the health of her babyShe has a 4 year old who when she was pregnant had twin to twin transfusion and had to terminate the life of one of the twins in order to save the life of my niecePlease keep me and my family in your thoughts and prayers that everyone is okThanks!
title: Please keep me in your prayers
